snippet: Commemorating what South Koreans call Liberation Day, President Park Geun-hye said “provocations” from the North would “lead only to isolation and destruction.”
abstract: South Korean Pres Park Geun-hye tells North Korea to stop military provocations on border after North threatens unrestrained attack on loudspeakers that South is using to disseminate propaganda; both countries stopped broadcasting propaganda at their border in 2004, but South Korea re-instituted practice after investigation determined North planted land mines in demilitarized zone that maimed South Korean soldiers.
lead_paragraph: Commemorating what South Koreans call Liberation Day, President Park Geun-hye said “provocations” from the North would “lead only to isolation and destruction.”

headline.main: South Korean Leader Marks Anniversary of War’s End With Warnings to North Korea
headline.print_headline: South Korean President Warns North on Threats
